outputs.output_descr: A collaboration between the Government of the Republic of Zambia, the Government of Japan, UNDP-Zambia, United Nations Volunteers and Grameen Trust.  It is aimed at developing an effective microfinance model for poverty reduction in Zambia through building the capacity of local Micro Finance Institutions (MFIs) in the sub-sector.  At least 2,400 poor people, especially women will receive micro-loans to improve their socio-economic situation.  Two local NGOs will implement the Project in Lusaka urban and Chongwe.  The project is in line with the Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper's (PRSP) main goal of poverty reduction and consistent with the Millenium Development Goals of eradicating poverty and hunger, gender equality and empowerment of women and HIV/AIDS.  This Project is also within the framework of the Agenda for Action as developed in the Tokyo International Conference on African Development (TICAD-II), which seeks to promote co-operation between Asia and Africa.

project_descr: Micro Finance for Poverty Reduction in Zambia
